Hi @{5b9791e8a9fd6d2c834b5864} , I had some time to look into this. I took some pictures of the `front_left_camera_link` and `front_left_camera_link_optical` in RViz. I compared these observed frames with the expected ones according to [ROS rep-0103](https://www.ros.org/reps/rep-0103.html).

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/151616584-left_camera_link.png)
![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/1982150883-left_camera_link_optical.png)
Some relevant info from the PEP:

```
== Axis Orientation ==
In relation to a body the standard is:

x forward
y left
z up

== Suffix Frames ==
In the case of cameras, there is often a second frame defined with a "_optical" suffix. This uses a slightly different convention:

z forward
x right
y down
```

Looks good to me! Thanks for the patch!
